channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: UK Weather: Flooding in London after heavy rain
item.description: Officials warn of hazardous travel conditions as heavy rainfall causes disruption in the capital.

item.title: Government pingdemic response chaotic, say food supply firms
item.description: Supply firms are having to fight to keep food on supermarket shelves, an industry body warns.

item.title: Two die in Newcastle stolen car police chase
item.description: Both men are pronounced dead at the scene in Newcastle, and two more people are seriously injured.

item.title: Brad Jones: Brands Hatch crash leaves superbike rider in coma
item.description: Brad Jones will be in an induced coma for up to 48 hours after crashing at Brands Hatch.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Speech comparing NHS medics to Nazis condemned
item.description: The Royal College of Nursing says the comments at a protest rally were "reprehensible".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Bradly Sinden takes silver for Great Britain after defeat in taekwondo final
item.description: Bradly Sinden takes silver for Great Britain after defeat by Uzbekistan's Ulugbek Rashitov in the taekwondo -68kg final.

item.title: Four injured as shots fired at Manchester engagement party
item.description: Two men, a woman and a 16-year-old girl were hospitalised after five shots were fired, police say.

item.title: Football manager Joey Barton charged with attacking woman
item.description: The former Premier League player is charged by police after an incident in London.

item.title: Climate change: Boy, 11, starts 200-mile walk
item.description: Jude will walk 10 miles each day for 21 days to reach Westminster, where he will lobby ministers.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chelsie Giles wins Team GB's first medal with judo bronze
item.description: Judoka Chelsie Giles wins Team GB's first medal of the Tokyo Olympics with bronze in the women's -52kg event.

item.title: East Dulwich stabbing: Man charged with murder of woman, 36
item.description: Beatrice Stoica, 36, died in hospital after a knife attack in East Dulwich, south-east London.

item.title: Thousands enjoy Latitude Festival after Covid cancels 2020 event
item.description: The organiser of the four-day event says "it's a dream come true" it has been able to go ahead.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Weed garden wins RHS gold at Tatton Park flower show
item.description: The team behind Weed Thriller want to show that native plants are essential for wildlife.

item.title: Chess: The 12-year-old boy taking the game by storm
item.description: "Shrez" has been playing chess since he was five and wants to become world champion one day.

item.title: Mental health: Derbyshire man pulls sack of coal to Newcastle
item.description: Ben Robertson pulls coal 120 miles to Newcastle to raise awareness of mental health.

item.title: The young imam using Instagram to change opinions
item.description: Sabah Ahmedi wants to show imams can "have a laugh", have "a bit of banter" and "wear colourful socks".

item.title: 'People have never seen anything like this before'
item.description: Live-streamed footage of a family of blue tits has had more than 41 million views online.

item.title: The Hundred: Matt Parkinson stars as Originals beat Phoenix for first win
item.description: Matt Parkinson bamboozles Birmingham Phoenix with a sensational spell of leg-spin bowling to give Manchester Originals their first win of The Hundred.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Bradly Sinden takes silver after Chelsie Giles wins bronze medal
item.description: Day two of the Tokyo 2020 Olympics brings Team GB's first medals with taekwondo silver for Bradly Sinden and Chelsie Giles winning judo bronze.

item.title: FSA chief says making proof of vaccination mandatory at football matches could cause 'chaos'
item.description: Making proof of full vaccination mandatory at Premier League matches could cause "chaos" at some clubs, the Football Supporters' Association has warned.

item.title: Super League: Further postponements for St Helens and Castleford Tigers
item.description: Super League games involving St Helens and Castleford Tigers are postponed because of coronavirus cases at the two clubs.

item.title: Cook guides Essex to win over Middlesex - One-Day Cup round-up
item.description: Former England captain Alastair Cook guides Essex to victory while Haseeb Hameed also shines with the bat in the One-Day Cup.
